repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
PROTOTYPE: do not merge

Allows:

```bash
echo "
local a = ...
" > file.lua
```

Better version of #19460

comment_regular_data.body: Didn't you veto adding more non-upstream directives before?
Hence the "PROTOTYPE" and "DO NOT MERGE" label. Atm this is just a proof of concept. Not sure how to implement this properly.

What do you think though?

I think it's generic enough that any application should be able to easily implement it.

Bikeshed on the name?

In this case, I'd rather add (even) smarter default language resolution, to be honest. Or, conversely, a more generic directive that allows specifying how the node contents are used. (Not sure how that'd work, but I worry about proliferation of such twisty little directives, all alike...)

Anyway, I thought that the point was "get it upstream first"?

The name should indeed be changed, as this could also mean the _buffer_ filename (which is something tree-sitter-test wants).

> In this case, I'd rather add (even) smarter default language resolution, to be honest. Or, conversely, a more generic directive that allows specifying how the node contents are used. (Not sure how that'd work, but I worry about proliferation of such twisty little directives, all alike...)

Hmm, how do you mean `injection.language` should ideally point to a treesitter language name, and for explictness sake, I think we should use directives to get that language name.

Or do you mean just allow `injection.langage` to be a filename? I guess that could work, but personally I prefer something to flag this is a filename, not a lang.

> Or do you mean just allow injection.langage to be a filename? 

Yes. We already do this for filetype, after all.
I keep this for myself for now.
Let's wait whether upstream wants to standardize that; then we can see how their version plays with Neovim's (much, _much_, more complex) filetype detection.

Helix has [`@injection.filename`](https://docs.helix-editor.com/master/guides/injection.html), so that would at least be a (two) editor standard. (Also `@injection.shebang`, which serves a similar purpose.)

I also think `@injection.filename` is good (and could be upstreamed), but if you wanted something more generic this could be solved with a new `#set!` property (`injection.from`?) which may include filename, shebang, and [grammar](https://github.com/tree-sitter-grammars/tree-sitter-test/blob/master/plugin/tstest.lua) injections.

Isn't `#set! injection.from <thing>` just `injection.<thing>` with extra steps? We can simply add `injection.shebang` if we want it. The grammar injections require a custom directive with or without this.
Yeah, `@injection.shebang` is also up for grabs but left as an exercise for the reader. (And I want to first see whether `tree-sitter` standardizes `@injection.filename`.

repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

labels.description: Nothing to see here; move along
labels.name: DO NOT MERGE

title: feat(treesitter): inject into bash file redirects
